body: Luis, I do not understand what you mean by optional/mandatory context?  Do you mean having the energy simulation component require that context be connected?  Whay would you need to change the component like this? Radiation is not necessarily more precise in an energy model than in an simple radiation study.  In an energy model, the accuracy of the radiation calculation depends upon the shadowPar and the solarDistribution of the "Energy Simulation Par": [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/iwhKaf*i-h0f9oyeOp6xDCe8Nk*2i9A0erbs6Kh3k2LAn*fUh*a6Y4Kw0TMC40zByaefhwUCspBZFVYPf7UINd-Vo9*fAb6-/Shadowpar.JPG) In a simple ladybug radiation study, the accuracy depends upon the grid size: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/iwhKaf*i-h1HuPMrNemrUEIPc65rHTMCFHuXmm1*l9WWK8PI8*PThIPUquol-ohBXNTzjP6tNAF7DZwPmCw-vgWOOPPsjLJO/LadybugPar.JPG) In a Daylight/Radiance study, the accuracy depends upon the grid Size and the radParameters: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/iwhKaf*i-h2gP47Z8I0NpNrXX*XkjVhTz7q7EU-7Lw*ZeKWMBMEJVHwK36Obka*PY*jMzFRz-8jTkQXU0YSO33Qm-d35A5YT/RadiancePar.JPG) In all cases, the accuracy is driven by the amount of time that you are willing to wait for the simulation to complete.  The accuracy of one of these simulations can be more or less than any of the others depending upon what these parameters are.  If you are after the most accurate simulation possible with a long run time, the Daylight/Radiance workflow (the last one) should be your choice. -Chris
